meanings.def: material that is made of string, thread or wire twisted or tied together, with small spaces in between; a piece of this material used for a particular purpose
examples: Unfortunately the animals are often caught in fishing nets.
She's always peering through the net curtains, spying on the neighbours.
They began to cut through the net, one strand at a time.
We slept in bamboo beds draped in mosquito nets.
The fishermen were mending their nets.
He bagged a huge net of carp and bream.

meanings.def: the frame covered in net that forms the goal
examples: to kick the ball into the back of the net
She shot the ball past the goalkeeper and into an empty net.
Kane finally found the net in the 78th minute.

meanings.def: the piece of net between the two players that the ball goes over
examples: She hit her second serve straight into the net.
to hit the ball over the net

meanings.def: a piece of ground with a net around it, used for practising batting and bowling
examples: He practised bowling all morning in the nets.
He spends his time playing computer games and surfing the net.

meanings.def: a network of radios or computers that are connected to each other
examples: A call on the radio net went out that there had been a crash.

meanings.def: to consider a lot of different people, activities, possibilities, etc. when you are looking for something
examples: It’s worth casting your net wide when applying for your first job.

meanings.def: when somebody/something slips through the net, an organization or a system fails to find them and deal with them
examples: We tried to contact all former students, but one or two slipped through the net.

meanings.def: to consider a wide range of possibilities or cover a large area, especially to try to find somebody/something
examples: They have spread their net far and wide in the search for a new team coach.

meanings.def: to consider or include a larger range of options or possibilities, especially when searching for something
examples: It's time to widen the net in the search for a suitable candidate.

idioms.def: to consider a lot of different people, activities, possibilities, etc. when you are looking for something
examples: It’s worth casting your net wide when applying for your first job.

idioms.def: when somebody/something slips through the net, an organization or a system fails to find them and deal with them
examples: We tried to contact all former students, but one or two slipped through the net.

idioms.def: to consider a wide range of possibilities or cover a large area, especially to try to find somebody/something
examples: They have spread their net far and wide in the search for a new team coach.

idioms.def: to consider or include a larger range of options or possibilities, especially when searching for something
examples: It's time to widen the net in the search for a suitable candidate.

meanings.def: an amount of money net is the amount that remains when nothing more is to be taken away
examples: a salary of $50 000 net
Interest on the investment will be paid net (= tax will already have been taken away).

meanings.def: a net amount of money is the amount that remains when nothing more is to be taken away
examples: a net profit of £500
net income/earnings (= after tax has been paid)
net of something What do you earn net of tax?

meanings.def: the net weight of something is the weight without its container or the material it is wrapped in
examples: 450 gms net weight

meanings.def: final, after all the important facts have been included
examples: The net result is that small shopkeepers are being forced out of business.
Canada is now a substantial net importer of medicines (= it imports more than it exports).
a net gain

meanings.def: to earn an amount of money as a profit after you have paid tax on it
examples: The sale of paintings netted £17 000.
The team have negotiated a sponsorship deal which should net them £30 000 over the next nine months.

meanings.def: to catch something, especially fish, in a net
to catch somebody or obtain something with skill
examples: A swoop by customs officers netted a large quantity of drugs.

meanings.def: to kick or hit a ball into the goal
examples: He has netted 21 goals so far this season.

meanings.def: to cover something with a net or nets
examples: It is a good idea to net the strawberry plants.
